results.title: Fresh water from the sea
results.creator_credit: Hearst Metrotone and United States Information Service
results.brief_description: Serious water shortages everywhere have led scientists to seek to transform sea water into fresh water. Two of these conversion plants, one in San Diego, California and the other in Freeport, Texas, are shown in operation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Hearst Metrotone and United States Information Service

results.title: Frescoes in Danish churches
results.creator_credit: Luciano Emmer, Dansk Kulturfilm, Teknisk Film and Jorgen Roos
results.brief_description: Uses church frescoes to relate a biblical theme. Depicts the creation and fall of man, the devil and death, the last judgement and hell. No dialogue is spoken in this film.

results.title: French Hortson cinema style 16mm projector
results.brief_description:
French Hortson cinema style 16mm projector. Unusual right-hand commercial projector, as used in European Cinemas. Manufactured in Paris, painted light blue, on cast iron stand. Model A.

results.title: French from France: to swim like a fish = Nager comme un poisson
results.creator_credit: Donald Carter, Associated Television, Schools Broadcast and Michael Style
results.brief_description: French language training film. Teaches French conversation, at the beach. Two girls sunbathe, swim, meet their friends and play a ball game. Their lively chatter using a wide vocabulary entertains and helps students with pronunciation in a natural way. Script by Jean Pierre Angremy, starring Claude Carroll as Marianne and Francois Apestoguy as Monique and members of the Comedie De L’Quest, Centre Dramatique National.

results.title: French explorations in the new world
results.brief_description: With the voyage of Verrazano, in 1524, began the story of France in the New World. Tracing the pattern of exploration through Verrazano, Cartier, Champlain, Marquette, Joliet and La Salle, the film shows how soldier-explorers and missionaries planted the earliest of French settlements and laid the foundations for French strongholds in the New World.
results.description: With the voyage of Verrazano, in 1524, began the story of France in the New World. results.title: French children: a farm family in Brittany
results.brief_description: Depicts a farm family living in Brittany. Emphasises family life, showing the work of each member and revealing customs and traditions. Includes scenes in a village school, an old castle and a neighbouring farm.

results.title: French Canadians: the St Lawrence Lowland, Quebec
results.creator_credit: J.H. Lenauer and Louis de Rochemont Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth and it’s peoples”.
Looks at life in the village of St Pierre in Quebec, depicting farming and dairying activities which have undergone little change for over three generations.

results.title: French-Canadian children
results.brief_description: A study of the home, school, and community life of a French-Canadian family, showing in particular the influence of the French heritage as it affects speech, manners, and customs.
